oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Calico Jamboree - Tillman Franks and his Rainbow Boys - WXLD
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Two excerpts of the Calico Jamboree radio program, featuring Tillman Franks and his Rainbow Boys (performers), including Levi Young, Merle Clayton, Pete Seegar, and "Blackie." Broadcast from the island of Saipan on radio station WXLD in 1944.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tillman Franks and his Rainbow Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Test tones -- Opening statement -- Listen To The Mockingbird (Blackie fiddle) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- Old Faithful (Tillman Franks and his Rainbow Boys) -- [Unidentified steel guitar tune] (Levi Young steel guitar) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- I Wonder Where You Are Tonight (Merle Clayton vocal) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- Schottische (Blackie fiddle) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- Rancho Grande (Tillman Franks and his Rainbow Boys) -- [Unidentified] and Blackie introduce the next tune -- Honeysuckle Rose (Tillman Franks and his Rainbow Boys) -- Closing statement -- Closing theme (incomplete) -- Opening theme -- Opening statement -- Rodeo Rag (Blackie fiddle) -- Celieto Lindo ([Unidentified]) -- Moon Over Miami (Levi Young steel guitar) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- Old Joe Clark (Pete Seegar vocals and banjo) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- Smoke On The Water (Merle Clayton vocals) -- [Unidentified] introduces the next tune -- Wednesday Night Waltz (Tillman Franks and his Rainbow Boys) -- [Unidentified] talks -- Way Out There (Merle Clayton and Pete Seegar vocals) -- Closing statement -- Closing theme
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Franks, Tillman; Rainbow Boys (Musical group)
